---
title: "git_invalid_ref_type.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file represents an invalid configuration for a Git storage setup. It demonstrates an example of an incorrect `ref_type` value in the Git configuration, which would likely cause an error when used in the actual application.

## Symbols

### `storage`
#### Description
The `storage` key is the root configuration block for defining storage settings.

#### Internal Logic
It contains two sub-keys: `type` and `git`, which specify the storage type and Git-specific configuration respectively.

### `storage.type`
#### Description
Specifies the type of storage to be used.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | The type of storage, set to "git" in this case |

### `storage.git`
#### Description
Contains Git-specific configuration settings.

#### Internal Logic
It includes three sub-keys: `repository`, `directory`, and `ref_type`, which define various aspects of the Git repository setup.

### `storage.git.repository`
#### Description
Specifies the Git repository URL.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| repository | string | The SSH URL of the Git repository |

### `storage.git.directory`
#### Description
Defines the directory within the Git repository.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| directory | string | The directory path within the repository |

### `storage.git.ref_type`
#### Description
Specifies the reference type for the Git repository, but contains an invalid value.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| ref_type | string | An invalid reference type ("wrong") |

## Error Handling
This configuration file is intentionally set up with an invalid `ref_type` value ("wrong"). In a real application, this would likely trigger an error during configuration parsing or when attempting to use the Git storage.

## TODOs
The `ref_type` value should be corrected to a valid Git reference type (e.g., "branch", "tag", or "commit") for the configuration to work properly.
